intro: Mitscherlichia grahamiana, commonly known as the Graham's mitscherlichia, is a flowering plant species native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and is often found in wetland habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
